Preparatory committee of Koreans in Russia formed to welcome Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Preparatory committee of Koreans in Russia formed to welcome Kim Jong Il 
    Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- The United Confederation of Koreans in Russia formed a preparatory committee in Moscow on July 27 to welcome leader Kim Jong Il.
 Ri Tong Chol, chairman of the confederation, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.    
 The committee adopted a decision calling on Koreans' organizations in the capital and various other regions to hold meetings to warmly welcome Kim Jong Il's historic Russia visit, present a congratulatory message and letter wishing him success in the visit and organize grandiose functions to welcome and see him off.

articles.title: Japan urged not to adopt distorted history textbooks
articles.content:
Japan urged not to adopt distorted history textbooks 
    Pyongyang, July 29 (KCNA) -- The council of chairmen of the 16 city and provincial education committees of South Korea on July 24 decided to send letters to more than 3,270 regional education committees of Japan, urging them not to adopt the distorted history textbooks, Seoul-based radio no. 1 reported.
 The council held that the educationists should teach a correct history to students and refuse to adopt and use the distorted history textbooks.
